Articles.Content:
probably Expansion to the stars will be for medium or high-end PCs, if you have low-end besides KSP It is a moderately heavy game also the mod is being programmed in KSP1.12.5 and if you have mods like EVE, Scatter, and others to improve the landscape will probably lower your FPS too much since this mod adds a lot of celestial bodies so when it comes out we will see the settings for a good experience, most likely the minimum requirements to run the mod are: GPU: Intel Core i3 Ryzen

3 RAM: 8.00

The other requirements are already allowed by the game, so that's a good thing.

known bugs

1-stellar systems with illumination of Kerbol and the parent star at the same time Failure of

2 lights in Gres

3 moons without textures

4-BIN file failure

The progress is that the appearance of April is confirmed and a planet called Agasus is confirmed, a gaseous planet that is the rarest of all the mods that orbits aprif, I also already have a download link for the beta version 0.19.0, the file is in mediafire because the file weighs more than 25 MB, it is only for pc and do not try to download it on the mobile

1-Install Kopernicus for the mod to work if you already have it, don't download it again

2-install the RAR file from the already mentioned link

3-open the RAR file

4-take out the folder that says Expancion_to_the_Stars and place it in your KSP Gamedata folder
